Posts.Content: joanne_elizabeth wrote: Finished TC about 3 1/2 weeks ago.  At the last tx the onc told me to go to a rads onc for a consult.  What???? This is after 3 surgeries including a mastectomy.  The rads onc "weakly recommends" rads.  What the heck does that mean?  Who was supposed to tell me this was on the horizon?  I had no idea rads was even in the picture. Did the rest of you know upfront you might need rads? I am having a VERY tough time thinking of doing this.  Joanne  Joanne_elizabeth Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Shocked - had no idea rads was coming joanne_elizabeth LizM

Posts.Content: joanne_elizabeth wrote: I had a mastectomy, am supposed to do rads.  What is it that makes reconstruction an issue after rads? Not sure I would ever reconstruct, but of course would like the option. Thanks, Joanne  Joanne_elizabeth Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Rads + Reconstructon + Mastectomy joanne_elizabeth muttnut

Posts.Title: Bone mets joanne_elizabeth LeggyJ

Posts.Content: joanne_elizabeth wrote: Has anyone else had the pain of discovering that the reassurance they have had from yearly mammograms were lies? That they had dense breasts which won't allow tumors to be seen on x-rays? Why are radiologists not smart enough to recommend alternate tests? I am appalled at the irresponsible behavior of the medical community. I had no idea breast x-rays missed 20-30% of tumors. Now I know. Joanne_elizabeth Log in to post a reply
